alert.note: Alert for Henderson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 26 at 4:50PM EST until December 28 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Henderson County in western North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 446 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated continued light rain showers. Between 4 and 5 inches of rain fell over this area in the past 24 hours and flooding is ongoing from runoff of the earlier rainfall. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hendersonville, Flat Rock, Mountain Home, Laurel Park, Valley Hill, East Flat Rock, Dana and Crab Creek. - Flooding is occurring along Mud Creek, with areas around William King Memorial Park affected. Flooding also continues along Bat Fork Creek, with flooding occurring along Dana and Tracy Grove Roads off Four Seasons Boulevard. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
